courseDescription: A course designed to cover the terminology and abbreviations used in the clinical sciences.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding and usage of medical terminology

courseTitle: Fundamental Concepts in Nuclear Medicine Technology
courseDescription: A course designed to cover the physical principles related to nuclear medicine technology.  The methods and mathematics of radioactive decay, types of radiation, radiation interactions, origins of radionuclides, including SPECT and PET/CT radionuclides also presented.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of physical principles related to nuclear medicine technology
Knowledge of methods and mathematics of radioactive decay
Identification of different types of radiation
Knowledge of SPECT and PET/CT radionuclides

courseDescription: This course is designed to familiarize the student with the theory, operation and quality assurance associated with the instrumentation found in a typical nuclear medicine department. The course also covers the instrumentation of PET/CT scanners as well as the common radiopharmaceuticals, imaging protocols, and radiation safety currently employed in diagnostic PET/CT imaging practice.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of nuclear medicine department instrumentation
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Interdisciplinary collaboration between nuclear medicine and radiology

courseDescription: Discussions of radiation effects on cellular systems as well as guidelines for radiation protection and safe handling of radioactive materials in the nuclear medicine clinical setting.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of radiation effects on cellular systems
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication in nuclear medicine clinical settings
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Evaluating safety protocols for radioactive materials
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Organizing radioactive materials for safe handling

courseDescription: A course  designed to cover the nuclear medicine procedures and protocols of the gastrointestinal, genitourinary, central nervous, skeletal systems. Other current or emerging clinical nuclear medicine procedures are also covered.
Technical and Digital Skills: Knowledge on protocols of the gastrointestinal, genitourinary, central nervous, skeletal systems
Adapting to new or emerging clinical nuclear medicine procedures
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Explaining complex medical procedures to patients
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Keeping up-to-date with emerging clinical nuclear medicine procedures

courseDescription: A course designed to cover the nuclear medicine protocols and procedures of the respiratory, cardiovascular, endocrine, infection/inflammation and lymphatic systems.  Other current and emerging clinical nuclear medicine procedures and protocols are also presented.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of nuclear medicine protocols and procedures
Knowledge of the respiratory, cardiovascular, endocrine, infection/inflammation and lymphatic systems
Ability to work with emerging clinical nuclear medicine procedures and protocols
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Ability to communicate complex medical procedures
Cooperating with medical staff for procedure implementation
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing patient information to determine appropriate procedures
Problem-solving to adapt to new and emerging procedures
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading in the implementation of new protocols and procedures

courseDescription: This course is designed to cover the concepts and techniques related to the field of radiopharmacy for nuclear medicine technology practice. The production, preparation, uses and quality assurance of radiopharmaceuticals are presented. Interventional and adjunctive pharmaceutical agents used in nuclear medicine will be covered.
Technical and Digital Skills: Knowledge on interventional and adjunctive pharmaceutical agents

courseDescription: This course covers the concepts, instrumentation and procedures pertaining to molecular imaging as related to nuclear medicine. Topics include: advanced Positron Emission Tomography (PET), Computed Tomography (CT), PET/CT, Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI), nuclear cardiology, theranostics, and other emerging technologies. Cross-sectional anatomy and radionuclide therapy, including monoclonal antibodies are also discussed. Review of all content for board examinations.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of advanced Positron Emission Tomography (PET)
Experience with Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) procedures
Knowledge of emerging technologies in molecular imaging
Proficiency in radionuclide therapy, including monoclonal antibodies
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Ability to explain complex nuclear medicine concepts
Proficiency in interpreting and communicating imaging results
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Ability to analyze and interpret imaging data
Problem-solving skills for troubleshooting imaging instrumentation and procedures
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Ability to organize and manage imaging procedures
Leadership skills in a medical imaging environment

courseDescription: Clinical instruction in patient care, radiation safety, radiopharmaceutical administration, imaging and non-imaging techniques and quality assurance procedures, including PET/CT.

Continued clinical instruction in diagnostic and therapeutic nuclear medicine procedures. The correlation of nuclear medicine procedures is also presented. Clinical experiences include patient care, radiation safety, radiopharmaceutical administration, imaging and non-imaging techniques and quality assurance procedures.
Technical and Digital Skills: Quality assurance procedures in nuclear medicine
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Ensuring compliance with radiation safety guidelines

courseTitle: Administration and Management in Nuclear Medicine Technology
courseDescription: This writing intensive, capstone course is designed to provide a review of the administration, management, policies, and practices relevant to nuclear medicine technology.  The leadership, legal, ethical and planning aspects of operating a nuclear medicine department are covered.
Technical and Digital Skills: Comprehending legal and ethical aspects of nuclear medicine
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication within a healthcare setting
Writing administrative and management reports in nuclear medicine
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing policies and practices in nuclear medicine technology
Problem-solving in the operational aspects of nuclear medicine
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leadership in a nuclear medicine department
Planning and managing nuclear medicine operations

courseTitle: Special Topics in Nuclear Medicine Technology
courseDescription: A study of selected current topics in nuclear medicine technology.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of current nuclear medicine technology
Proficiency in operating nuclear medicine equipment
Knowledge of nuclear medicine procedures and protocols
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication in a medical setting
Explaining complex medical procedures to patients
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical evaluation of nuclear medicine studies
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Supervision and leadership in a nuclear medicine department

courseTitle: Directed Study in Nuclear Medicine Technology
courseDescription: Directed study in a topic relevant to nuclear medicine technology.
Technical and Digital Skills: Ability to use relevant technical equipment and software
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication of complex technical information
Collaboration with medical professionals and patients
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Identification and resolution of technical issues in nuclear medicine technology
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Adherence to safety protocols and regulations

courseTitle: Directed Research in Nuclear Medicine Technology
courseDescription: Supervised research on a specific problem in Nuclear Medicine Technology. Regular meetings with faculty and a written/oral report are required.
Special topic related to the field of nuclear medicine technology and molecular imaging.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Troubleshooting technical issues in imaging equipment
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Adhering to safety and compliance standards in nuclear medicine

courseTitle: Directed Study in Nuclear Medicine Technology
courseDescription: Directed study in a topic or area relevant to nuclear medicine or nuclear medicine technology.
Technical and Digital Skills: Ability to use nuclear medicine equipment
Knowledge in safe handling of radioactive materials
Ability to interpret nuclear medicine data
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Ability to communicate complex nuclear medicine concepts
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Conducting independent research in nuclear medicine
Leading projects in nuclear medicine technology

courseDescription: Research on a topic or project related to nuclear medicine or nuclear medicine technology.
Thesis on a topic in nuclear medicine/molecular imaging or nuclear medicine technology.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical evaluation of nuclear medicine/molecular imaging studies
